channel.title: Windows Vista Help
channel.description:
Well.. I'm using one of my old computers, and it's not a bad computer tbh... and I was wondering if there is any [b]CORE[/b] ways I could speed it up.
No, don't tell me all the obvious stuff like changing virtual memory and screen resolution, Windows Colors and Style.
I mean programs or anything that will make it run at least 25% more faster with programs; Yes, My computer is set to Run best for Programs so please, don't suggest that.
Anyways, I hope you can help, I tried Google and there just obvious stuff that anyone without a brain would know.
Hope you can help. [img]http://blackboard.uic.edu/webapps/lobj-expo-bb_bb60/user/garay/ITL_Blog/Home?cmd=GetImage&systemId=WindowsVista.small.logo__1.jpg[/img]

item.title: Windows Vista Help
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

Well… I’m using one of my old computers, and it’s not a bad computer tbh… and I was wondering if there is any CORE ways I could speed it up.

No, don’t tell me all the obvious stuff like changing virtual memory and screen resolution, Windows Colors and Style.

I mean programs or anything that will make it run at least 25% more faster with programs; Yes, My computer is set to Run best for Programs so please, don’t suggest that.

Anyways, I hope you can help, I tried Google and there just obvious stuff that anyone without a brain would know.

Hope you can help.
